name: Bug Pharmacist - Tim Gauthier
bio:
I 💚 bugs & drugs
BCPS & BCIDP Pharmacist
Making it easier to 🧠 antimicrobials & pathogens
🐦: 35K 👍: 22K 🌐: 5M 📧: 25K
🗣Opinions mine.

social_posts.post_text: 👀 Beware clindamycin resistance in MRSA, particularly in the hospital setting. Check the D-test for inducible clindamycin resistance… not to mention it’s association with 💩 💦💦 C diff… and yes we are still doing antibiotic memes 😂…… #pharmacy #clindamycin #antibiotics #pharmacymeme #pharmlife

💊 You know those antibiotics are working on the weekend!…. 🧐 Beware E. coli resistance to amoxicillin-clavulanic acid (Augmentin) & it’s counterpart ampicillin-sulbactam (Unasyn). If resistance at play is due to a beta-lactamase (which is a pretty common mechanism of resistance for Gram negative bacteria), that beta-lactamase inhibition with clavulanic acid or sulbactam may be just the thing to help kill the bug. 🚦🤨 I don’t trust Augmentin or Unasyn to treat a serious E. coli infection without confirmed susceptibilities bc resistance rates can be in the 60%-range, but if known to be sensitive these can be great! ……. #bugsanddrugs #betalactams #pharmacy #pharmacist

Meropenem 🛡🧫🛡resistance in Gram negative bacteria is not fun. Use only when necessary. Use only for the duration needed. The more we USE meropenem, the more we LOSE meropenem. #SaveABX #DefendMeropenem #SaveMerrem #Pharmacy #pharmacist #IDstewardship

🥴🤑Feeling bad for the P4s out there paying for midyear, PPS, flights, rentals, and all the costs that snowball at a time when you are nearing your peak college 💰debt time. Been there. It’s rough. Today I think of these things like 🐠Dori from the movie Finding Nemo: JUST KEEP SWIMMING! …unsolicited 🗣  shout out to @yourfinancialpharmacist for giving so many resources on finance for the pharmacy peeps!! …… #Pharmacistlife #pharmlife #pharmacyschool #pharmacistdebt #everythingissofreakongexpensive

🕰 What’s the longest you ever had to be rounding for? I think for me it’s around ~5 hours. Over time I learned to 👋 excuse myself if my presence was not helping and there was other pressing work to be done. Rounds is important, but it’s also important to 🖥 get other work done too… Doc Adi 😂 …….. #MedLife #PharmLife #RoundingBID #LongestRoundsEver #Pharmacist #Doctor
Be safe out there y’all.

📸📘 Had a little photo shoot with my new friend, which can be found on 📱Amazon. #LearnAntibiotics #Pharmacist #Pharmacy #Antibiotics #SaveABX #Reslife #PharmacyRes #MedicalRes #Pharmacotherapy #ClinicalPharmacology

Many people (including myself) like to 🤨 poke at when we are over-using vancosyn to drive home an educational point, but the truth is sometimes vancomycin plus Zosyn can indeed be the right tools for the job. One example is when initiating empiric therapy for 🦶 diabetic foot infection following surgery with sending deep tissue cultures, in which it is expected polymicrobial infection may be present, possibly including MRSA, Pseudomonas, and anaerobes. There is an 📄 IDSA guideline on the topic of diabetic foot infections (DFIs) if you want to know more. ……….. #Pharmacy #DiabeticFoot #Antibiotic #Scrollandlearn #Staphwars #medicine #pharmacyres

📸 Antibiotics and chill …may not mean the same thing to someone studying pharmacy as to the general public 😂 ……. #Pharmacy #Pharmacist #Antibiotics #LearnAntibiotics #Bugsanddrugs ….you can see the drugs (it’s amoxicillin tabs) but the bugs are too small to see! 🔬💊

You can ➕ metronidazole to cefepime if you need anaerobic coverage, but let’s be honest, it’s often the 💉 cefepime doing all the work!…. Some times when anaerobes may be true problems includes with 🤒 intraabdominal infections and 🦶diabetic foot infections…. #pharmacy #metronidazole #antibiotics #bugsversusdrugs #flagyl #learnantibiotics #idstewardship

📸 Medical glam shot with the #LearnAntibiotics book. I considered 🖊 labeling the spatula “Penicillin” as working in community #pharmacy we used to have one specific tray for penicillins and another for sulfas and another for everything else. Always well 🧽 cleaned with etoh between uses… 🤷‍♂️ Do people still do that? I haven’t worked in a community pharmacy in quite some time…… #Pharmacist #Pharmlife #bugsandsrugs #Antibiotics #IDstewardship #InfectiousDiseases
‘This the season to spread 😊 joy and cheer. 🎁 Happy holidays and Merry Christmas! #Amoxicillin #ClavulanicAcid #Inamedmyelfclavulanate #Pharmacist #Pharmlife #Antibiotics #Augmentin
🎁 📖 Best present ever! #ThankYouSanta ….Wishing everyone a health and happy holiday season!

🗣 According to CDC, watchful waiting in the setting of a pediatric ear infection is: “It means observing your child for 2–3 days to give your child’s immune system time to fight off the infection rather than starting antibiotics immediately. Your healthcare professional will wait to see if your child gets better before giving your child a prescription for antibiotics.” …avoiding unnecessary antibiotics in children is always a 🙌 win for patient safety, but watching and waiting has to be under the oversight of a 👩‍⚕️👨‍⚕️licensed healthcare professional. I saw someone on Twitter 💬 say they use the term “patience” instead of “watch and wait”, it makes me 🤔 curious if this different terminology may be better received by some patients? 🤷‍♂️….. #WatchAndWait #OtitisMedia #Pharmacy #Pharmacist … @cdcgov provides info on it here: https://www.cdc.gov/antibiotic-use/pdfs/watchfulwaitingear-p.pdf

🤓📚🏖 Can you study poolside?… I once brought DiPiro’s Pharmacotherapy book (weighs like 12 pounds) all the way from Boston to Palm Beach as a pharmacy student, thinking I would study it on vacation. 😆 Total fail… any secrets to actually following through on poolside studies? 🤷‍♂️ …….. #Pharmacyschool #poolside #learnantibiotics #pharmlife #pharmacyresidency #bcps #bcidp #naplex #PANCE #IDstewardship #bugsanddrugs

When 👩‍⚕️🧑‍⚕️👨‍⚕️ attendings change back and forth plans can take ⤴️⤵️↩️↪️🔁 abrupt turns. One thing throughout my career that has been important to navigating things like this is to identify/respect the 📶  chain of command. That ✋doesn’t mean slam someone who is under you BTW, it means 👌 give the people with authority the clearance that is due to make the ✅ call they have the authority to make. If you 😑 don’t like their plan, follow the 📶 chain of command to try to influence improvement opportunities. Short term wins for long term losses bc of skipping around on the chain of command is dangerous ground for antibiotic stewards who need 🤝 good relationships to have success in complex 🏥🏪🏥🏩🏫🏘🏠 medical systems…… #AntibioticStewardship #Pharmacist #PharmLife #NewAttendingOnService #MedicineLife #InfectiousDiseases #HospitalPharmacy #ClinicalPharmacy #Pharmacotherapy

📦 Oh the places you will go! The #LearnAntibiotics book has made it all over the 🌎🌍🌏 world and it’s pretty amazing. I’m ☺️ blown away. Across the US, down to Mexico, up to Canada, over to Spain, around the corner to the UK, down to India, all the way to Australia, and much more! …The support groom a global group of people goes beyond words. 🙏 THANK YOU!!! #Grateful #Pharmacist #ClinicalPharmacy

🤔 You ever think about the sheer number of each 👾 bacteria type that can be infecting something like a 🤕🦶diabetic foot? It’s a lot… 🙌 Thank god for 🖥rapid diagnostics like PCR technology that help us identify these bugs quickly so we don’t always have to wait 📆📆📆 days for them to 🧫 grow to figure out 🔬which ones are there and if some resistance mechanisms are present……. #IDconsult #idstewardship #clinicalrounds #hospitalrounds #wardrounds #pharmacist #pharmlife #lablife #medmicro #infectiousdiseases #antibiotics #fightAMR #SaveABX #BadBugsNeedDrugs

🧫 This is a culture from about 10 years ago.  It is not the first nor the last I’ve seen like it, but cultures like this are what 🔥🔥 ignited my passion for infectious disease and showed me how it’s worth our time to 🤓💬 fight for safe and rational antibiotic use. Keep up the good fight! Every dose matters. Every patient matters. It’s hard work and 🫠 not always well received by all, but you are 💫 making a difference so keep fighting!! #SaveABX #ABXstewardship #DefendABX #ProtectedAntibiotics #IDconsult #DoTheyHaveSymptoms #HowLongAreWeTreatingThisFor #IsThisTheRightAntibiotoc #CanWeUseSomethingOral #Stewardmeme

🤓 How many times in your life have you adjusted 🩸vancomycin level orders? Communicated with nursing or lab to get the draw time right? Personally, a lot for me. It 🙃 may not be super exciting and it may feel like Groundhog Day sometimes, but it’s important work to get 🎯 the levels right and get the doses reasonable… 🌟 Just don’t forget, the easiest vancomycin monitoring plan is for the patient who can have it discontinued because they don’t need it anymore! #StartWithTheIndication #CheckTheCultures #ReasonForTherapy? #AntibioticTimeOut #StartSmartThenNarrow #MRSAnares #Pharmacist #pharmacyschool #idstewardship

🫣Okay I might have made up at least one of these bc I thought it was cute, but how many of these have you 👂🏼 heard? Any 😍 favorites? Of course we will all never agree on cefazolin pronunciation 😂. 🤔 Other examples come to mind? …stepping back away from these fun examples, beware that how 🙂💬 you say things can impact your credibility. So before accidentally butchering a drug or organism name, try to 🗣 practice ahead of time whenever possible. Not only is it 😲 impressive to hear someone smoothly say things like “Aggregatibacter actinomycetemcomitans” or “Pseudallescheria boydii”, it leaves the impression you have done your homework or are generally familiar with the topic. #AntibioticNames #BacteriaNames #Stewardmeme #IDstewardship #Bugsanddrugs #ClinicalPharmacy #Pharmacotherapy #PharmacyRes

🏨 Want one installed in your pharmacy? How 🙌 cool would it be to have the option to add an inhibitor on demand to whichever beta-lactam you want?? 🤔💭A boy can dream!!! #Betalactams #BLBLIs #Pharmacist #Pharmacy #Pharmacotherapy #clinicalpharmacy #badbugsneeddrugs
📸 I hope these are relatable! #SaveABX #StartSmartThenNarrow #pharmacist #pharmacy #pharmlife

The work of an ID pharmacist is tough, especially to keep at it day after day, year after year. 👏Keep going out there and putting in work y’all! Start the right 💊drugs. Stop the wrong ones. Find 🤔reasonable options when you find yourself with no “right” option…. A mentor taught me to always adhere to 3 things: 1️⃣ The patient always comes first, 2️⃣ everyone deserves to be shown respect, 3️⃣ use your skills to improve the lives of others… always remember these things as you go put in work and get some wins!!!! #Pharmacist #pharmlife #pharmacyschool #pharmacotherapy #ivents #clinicalpharmacy #antimicrobialstewardship #saveabx #startsmartthennarrow

1- A discontinued vanco is easier to dose/monitor than a vanco that is not indicated. It’s also 😊safer for the patient!… 2-💊Let’s go PO! Hate the D5W fluid load and hyperkalemia that tends to come with 💉 IV Bactrim… 3-Do you really want to ask an ID guy about cardiology? 😉… 4- The thrill of a great idea sometimes outweighs the journey to work on another, 🫣💬✖️ so hard to say no!… 5-Cold 📞 calling people is really hard. Sometimes it’s better to “eat the frog” and get it over with, but wouldn’t you rather 😁😁have a nice chat with your main squeeze first?… 6-Cefdinir May be a 3rd gen ceph and cefuroxime may be a 2nd, but that cefdinir absorption ain’t so great and 🤔 that cefuroxime coverage sure looks similar even though it’s a different generation!… 7- It’s fine to start with an idea but we must work with people who live it every day in order to achieve true practice improvements. Being a leader means you also have to be a 👂🏼 listener…… #PharmacyVibes #PharmacyFeels #IDpharmlife #ClinicalPharmacy #Antibiotics #learnantibiotics #idstewardship #pharmacist #pharmacy #pharmacyschool #pharmacyresidents

1️⃣ Please don’t let your 🐈🐕👅 pets lick your open wounds. 2️⃣ Wash your hands, 👀we are watching! 3️⃣ Be nice to the people in the lab, 😊be mindful. 4️⃣ 🤔 Should everyone get credit for a bad question on a 50-question test (which inflates all grades) or should it be thrown out and graded out of 49 questions instead? 🤔 5️⃣ Don’t mess with nurses. 6️⃣ Pay attention and ✋don’t give your pharm techs unnecessary work. Yes clinical pharmacy is important, but never disregard the importance of operations! 7️⃣ Did you know oxacillin/nafcillin are pretty 💰expensive compared to cefazolin? It’s true! 8️⃣ A patient may be pretty healthy and need to be an an ICU for an allergy desensitization, but 😾don’t expect the ICU chief to be happy about it! 9️⃣ Don’t order vancomycin to be administered IV for treating C diff, ‼️ it won’t get to the site of infection. You can however use IV vanco given oral to treat C diff, but I hear the taste is pretty gross………. #LearnAntibiotics #ClinicalPharmacy #IDpharmacist #ASPpharmacist #pharmacistlife #antibiotics #pharmacyschool #stewardmeme #pharmacymeme #medicalmeme #pharmacist

More nephrotoxins, ⏫ more risk for nephrotoxicity. ❌Discontinue antibiotics as soon as they aren’t needed. Don’t take the risk. 🫘👀Mind the beans (an unofficial term for kidneys which are shaped like beans)……… #Pharmacy #Pharmacist #Pharmlife #antibiotics #idpharmd #clinicalpharmacy #acyclovir #idstewardship #learnabx

👾🧫🔥 E. coli is the most common pathogen to cause urinary tract infection. 💊 Nitrofurantoin is a go to for cystitis caused by UTI. Fluoroquinolones have fallen out of favor pretty hard in the last decade for UTI despite many folks being taught “cipro is a go-to for UTI”, ⚠️use fluoroquinolones only when other options are not reasonable, due to their many toxicity concerns and resistance rates. #FeelingTheBurn #SymptomFreePeeLetItBe #Dysuria #clinpharm #pharmres #pharmacist #clinicalpharmacy #BCPS #BCIDP #Scrollandlearn #IDstewardship #Antibiotics #pharmacyschool #pharmlife #basbugsneeddrugs #itburnswhenipee

🫣👨🏼‍🦳👵🏻 Can you relate??? I can relate to this more and more every year (nearing 40 now). Once upon a time I was at an event when I was junior pharmacy school faculty, I was 26, a student asked me if I was a P2 🤣, to this day I cherish this complement… 🤷‍♂️ I may be wrong, but I think the 🤫 secret to being a good teacher to people from different generations is through trying to put yourself in their 👞 shoes and 👂🏼 listening to what they want to work on, 🗣 communicating expectations, and 🔎 identifying what they don’t know so it can be worked on (ie, give them a open-ended fundamentals 📝 test and see what they get right/wrong). 👋How do you connect with your learners???? ….. #PharmacyPreceptor #PreceptResponsibly #Pharmacist #Pharmlife #Pharmacyschool #pharmres #pharmacists #IDstewardship #pharmschool

🤓Had the pleasure to 🤝 meet a pharmacist in Madrid 🇪🇸 and he was kind to show me a few of the 💊#antibiotics they carry. Interestingly these antibiotics come in fixed packs for dispensing that are not to be broken up, so some countries like Spain may have trouble with ‘shorter is better’ bc there is less flexibility on how many pills are put into the community when the only options are 7 or 10 days… In case you are wondering, a 📝 prescription is needed to get antibiotics legally in Spain… pretty neat the brail is printed on the box… 👋😃If you recognize this pharmacy please say hi and thank them again for me! 🙏They were very kind to take the time to show me these and tolerate my street-level 🗣Spanish skills…. #Pharmacist #Pharmacy #pharmacia #pharmaciaAnaVasquez #madridpharmacia #antibiotico #SaveABX #LearnABX #IDstewardship

#Doxy #doxycycline what doesn’t it work for? 🤔 Well of course some things, lol. Besides having a lot of clinical utility, I ❤️ that doxy has a low risk for causing C difficile. A few studies even have suggested doxy might 🛡 protect against it! 🤩Pretty amazing drug, no wonder is the favorite antibiotic of so many ID professionals! ……… #Antibiotics #SaveABX #BadBugsNeedDrugs #IDtwitter #BlueTicks #TwitteRx #Pharmacist #Pharmlife

👑 Some royal #medicalmemes from the recent #coronation of a #king …. 🌟 Remember when it comes to #antibiotics, ✋ there is no king. Use in one person can impact efficacy in another… 🌎🌍🌏We all own antibiotics collectively and have a shared responsibility to use them 🧠 wisely, no matter who you are……. #StartSmartThenNarrow #WatchAndWait #rightdiagnosisrightdrug #symptomfreepeeletitbe #saveabx #badbugsneeddrugs #pharmacist #pharmlife #medlife #medicine #nursing #hospitalpharmacy

📖 🦸‍♂️ I use my super powers to pick things up around the house sometimes…📱 You can find #LearnAntibiotics on Amazon as a soft cover book. It is full of fundamentals of infectious diseases but is not just for students/ residents/ fellows. 🌟 This book is helpful for practicing pharmacists or other professionals (PAs, MDs, APRN, nurses, etc) many people use it to study for BCPS or BCIDP or boards like NAPLEX. I used it and LearnAntibiotics.com plus IDstewardship.com to study for BCIDP… 🙏Thanks to all who have picked up a copy or registered a membership at learnantibiotics.com, because this support is what keeps IDstewardship going!….. #Pharmacist #PharmacySchool #PharmLife #PharmRes #InfectiousDiseases #Antibiotics #Pharmacology #Microbiology #ClinMicro #PharmD #PharmDstudent #IDstewardship

👩‍🔬🥽🧪This magnetic stirrer is a fun science tool to do with the kiddos or even just to play with as an adult, lol... Picked it up on Amazon (where you can also find the Learn Antibiotics book!). 🩸A little food coloring and we have a colored 🌪vortex! Gets a bit messy when we start throwing in some alkaseltzer we crush up in our mortar and pestle, but the mess is worth it for the good sciency fun. #Pharmacist #Pharmacy #pharmlife #magneticstirrer #ScienceFriday #ScienceKids #Antibiotics

Speaking of 🩸 sugar, did you know that 💊 fluoroquinolone antibiotics like ciprofloxacin and levofloxacin, when give systemically, can cause blood glucose issues? An 🚨 issued by FDA in 2018 states “Blood Glucose Disturbances subsection of the labeling for all systemic fluoroquinolones will now be required to explicitly reflect the potential risk of coma with hypoglycemia.” …available at https://www.fda.gov/news-events/press-announcements/fda-updates-warnings-fluoroquinolone-antibiotics-risks-mental-health-and-low-blood-sugar-adverse …… #Pharmacist #Antibiotics #InsulinPimp #InsulinPump #medicine #MedicalErrors #pharmacyresidents

🧑‍⚕️New medical residents get the pleasure of learning what clinical pharmacists are this month. 🤓Go easy on our new colleagues and remember that we all were trainees once upon a time!…. 1️⃣Check abx stop dates daily to avoid excessive exposure… 2️⃣avoid fluoroquinolones except for very specific circumstances where there are no/ limited options… 3️⃣oral vanco is only for C diff… 4️⃣CTX-M means it’s an ESBL, use a carbapenem for ESBL E. coli bacteremia I’m ending full sensitivities… 5️⃣don’t go IV when you can go PO out the gate… 6️⃣respect the institutional antibiotic restrictions/protections… 7️⃣tigecycline doesn’t work for pseudomonas… 8️⃣linezolid is contraindicated with MAOIs… 9️⃣daptomycin wont work for pneumonia bc it is inactivated by surfactant….… #Bugsanddrugs #idstewardship #pharmacist #clinicalpharmacy #pharmres #scrollandlearn #learnantibiotics #idweek2023

📸 I think this might be a nice resource so posting it here for future reference… 🧠 knowing about PBP affinity can help with understanding why in some scenarios dual beta-lactam therapy can be reasonable (which tend to be few and far)… for example when using ceftiaxone + ampicillin for Enterococcal infective endocarditis. Ampicillin has at least some activity versus PBP 1, 4, and 5. Some cephalosporins can add substantially to this including activity versus PBP 2 and 3. The result of the greater overall PBP saturation is thought to produce 💥 more complete inhibition of cell wall synthesis and therefore enhanced bacterial killing! Hazah! 😃 We like dead bugs around here, bc dead bugs can’t cause infections..………….. #PBP #Antibiotics #MechanismOfAction #Pharmlife #Pharmacology #bugsanddrugs

📸😁 Some #barbenhiemer memes for a Saturday… Coagulase negative staph is often a contaminant that does not require treatment, M abscessus can also be a contaminant but it’s 🫣 super difficult to treat and is a scary bug bc of drug resistance… PO linezolid is a few bucks a pill while IV remdesivir is a 💰pharmacy budget buster at thousands of dollars for a 5-day course… publishing fees are 🤪 insane especially when they also take in major ad revenue… azithromycin has legit ⚠️ toxicities to beware, but next to the fluoroquinolones (which have numerous FDA boxed warnings) azithromycin is not nearly as concerning… oral fluconazole is an 😌easy order to fill but compounding Ambisome is 🥴 a time intensive task for just a single dose… y’all heard about the Pfizer plant hit by a 🌪tornado? Gulp. 🤞Let’s hope shortages aren’t too bad… Probably should have put 👵elderly women, but my point being if asymptomatic and just want a UA, ordering a UA with reflex can lead to getting 📠micro results that were never needed and subsequently possibly treatment that was never indicated… 🏷Allergy labels have huge impact on 🤔 antibiotic decision making, a good allergy history can support better and safer treatment… Nitrofurantoin commonly is >90% effective against E. coli, while amox/clav is usually in the 40%-range on cumulative institutional antibiograms… doxycycline may actually reduce the risk for C diff, while clindamycin is highest risk for causing it……. #Antibiotics #Pharmacist #IDstewardship #Pharmacyschool #Scrollandlearn #MedSchool #pharmacymemes #medicalmemes #pharmtech

🤩 After many years I finally got my hands on a 📖 copy of the #bacterionomicon! Yeep! 👀 Purchased from nerdcore.com where I may have also picked up two posters too… if you like ID and magic the gathering, or just ID 😂, you might like this….. #infectiousdiseases #SaveABX #IDstewardship #pharmacynerd #Pharmlife #pharmacyschool #Pharmtastic

💊💉 We have numerous drug classes to reach for when treating an 🤒 E. coli infection, yet the world is still struggling to combat drug-resistant isolates… the problem with developing drugs that actually cure things or the may not work due to microbial resistance, is there is less opportunity for a return on investment. Antibiotics are different than other drugs… 🌟 use wisely, use only when indicated… #SaveABX #Ecoli #Antibiotics #infectiousdiseases #pharmacist #pharmacy #pharmacyschool #learnantibiotics #idstewardship #badbugsneeddrugs #defendabx

🫣You know it’s the viruses that make me concerned, occupational hazard and all… but what is your biggest back to school 🫠 vibe?? #Backtoschool #Pharmlife #Pharmacyschool #NursingSchool #MedSchool #PAschool

🫠Those fluoroquinolones may work for some infections, but with all of the toxicities and collateral damage, boy they have 🫠🫠🫠not aged well… 🤒Vibrio vulnificus has killed several in Florida this year and comes from 🌊 salt water, causing rapidly progressing disease that is not to be taken lightly. Mycobacterium marinum is also tied to 🌊 salt water exposure but grows very slowly and is less aggressive. Still not to be taken lightly but not nearly as 😧 scary as V. vulnificus… It’s funny how branded drug packaging is so 🎁fancy while generic is so 📦plain, but 99% of the time it’s literally the same drug/ therapeutic index… 💊 📕 pharmacy school is intense… and so is 💻 annual required education 🤣 ……. #Pharmacist #PharmacySchool #Pharmlife #antibiotics #learnantibiotics #bugsanddrugs #stewardmeme #pharmacymemes #medicalmemes

I did a few times, 😰 terrified of failing a class and losing a year of my life waiting to take it again with the pharmacy class the year below… It was an absolutely terrible way to try to 🧠 learn something, but it taught me the value of understanding the learning process and how cramming does not work at all for creating long-term memory. 🤔 Can you name other antimicrobial members of the 1gm vial club? 🤔💭Try to think of the drugs by class to go through them in your head… penicillins, cephalosporins, carbapenems, aztreonam, FQs, tetracyclines, glycopeptides, aminoglycosides, etc… 🤓then think antivirals, antifungals… ❓can you get a few that aren’t shown?… 🌟Clinical pharmacists need to know about drug vials and pharmacy operations to realize their full positive impact they can have on healthcare systems 🤓💪… btw one lesson I learned for med safety is if you ever need more than 2 vials to make a dose of something, ⚠️you better ✅✅✅ triple check that dose is right bc that doesn’t happen all that often!…. #pharmlife #druggist #IDstewardship #pharmacist #pharmtech #pharmops #pharmacyschool #learnabx #learnantibiotics

👀 Yeasts are a major category of fungi and Candida sp. are one of the big categories of yeasts. The most common Candida sp. seen in clinical practice is C. albicans, but there are many other species. When a specimen in the microbiology lab is flagged as positive for a Candida sp. it can mean a variety of things. On one hand Candida sp. in a blood culture almost always requires treatment, since Candida should not be normally found in your bloodstream and blood culture contamination with yeasts is not very common. On the other hand, Candida sp. in a respiratory or urinary culture may often not require treatment, as Candida sp. colonize the GI tract and this can lead to culture contamination/ detection of colonization.

When a urine culture is positive for Candida sp., the clinician must investigate the circumstances that led to the Candida sp. recovery. This includes considering the likelihood of (a) urine culture contamination/ detection of colonization vs. (b) asymptomatic candiduria (i.e., Candida sp. in the urine in the absence of symptoms) vs. (c) lower Candida sp. UTI vs. (d) upper Candida sp. UTI (i.e., pyelonephritis). Clinicians must weigh the risks and benefits of prescribing an antifungal. Recognizing limitations of the available antifungal options is important when making this assessment. Actions such as removing indwelling catheters should also be considered, when applicable. 

As many as 80% of candiduria cases in hospitalized patients may be asymptomatic, for which treatment is usually inappropriate. Unnecessary treatment exposes patients to avoidable risks associated with antifungals which may include hepatotoxicity, drug-drug interaction, and arrhythmias. According to IDSA guidelines, high-risk patients may require treatment of asymptomatic candiduria. This includes neutropenic patients, very low-birth-weight infants (<1.5 kg), and patients who will undergo urologic manipulation... read the rest at https://www.idstewardship.com/id-pharmd-qa/ #Pharmacist #Pharmacy #Antifungals #Antibiotic #PharmEd #MedEd

👨‍⚕️💬 “A microbiology laboratory tested 85 clinical isolates of beta streptococci for susceptibility to trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole, clindamycin, and doxycycline. The surprise (to some) winner?  Trim-sulfa (100%), followed by clindamycin (85%), with every ID doc’s favorite doxycycline bringing up the rear, with only 57% susceptible. Some would argue that this in vitro activity of trim-sulfa vs. strep has long been proven in clinical studies of skin and soft tissue infections (such as one in kids and one in kids and adults), but that hasn’t stopped clinicians from frequently choosing double therapy with beta lactams plus trim sulfa for outpatient treatment of these infections. Guidelines, too, steer people away from trim sulfa for strep. Trim sulfa’s bad reputation vs. strep stems from an artifact introduced in a now outdated method of resistance testing, which had high thymidine content of the test media inhibiting the activity of the drug.” …text from Dr Sax blog watch posted in my stories and at: https://blogs.jwatch.org/hiv-id-observations/index.php/a-holiday-season-2023-id-link-o-rama/2023/12/22/?fbclid=PAAaZH5jAg_EPG_pl3LnYNWi0YU6VArIA3oAl2DMO56GfG4z_n-I0MM4-fWvg_aem_AXdssPD4c8hCNMqSRTabPIZCtSewJ2tRA0SXS71G_v4jvtNzPuZ59DztXwEgUrnj9us #Bactrim #Medmicro #clinmicro #pharmacist #IDstewardship #bugsanddrugs

🤓💬 Antimicrobial stewardship pharmacists facilitate the safe and appropriate use of antimicrobial drugs. This includes antibacterials, antifungals, antivirals, and antiparasitic medications. It is not limited to any specific setting.

The job of an antimicrobial stewardship pharmacist is complex. It involves education, informatics, drug information, performance improvement, team building, coaching, regulatory preparedness, championing campaigns, implementation science, systems optimization, engaging stakeholders, facilitating medication or lab test utilization evaluations, data analysis, running meetings, and much more. Being familiar with core infectious diseases concepts is critical to being successful as an antimicrobial stewardship pharmacist.

There is a large administrative component to being an antimicrobial stewardship pharmacist, but it is much different than other traditional administrative pharmacy roles.

Antimicrobial stewardship pharmacists typically do the “heavy lifting” and “day to day” tasks of most stewardship programs. They have the best understanding of local practices and system dynamics. They understand the local data better than others. That stated, antimicrobial stewardship pharmacists will almost never be successful without the support of the medical staff. More importantly, healthy relationships with infectious diseases physicians are critical to antimicrobial stewardship program success. Relationship building and communication are key elements for antimicrobial stewardship pharmacists.

More at: https://www.idstewardship.com/id-pharmd-qa/

🔗Full answer at: https://www.idstewardship.com/id-pharmd-qa/ … but here are two article summaries for a snippet: 1️⃣ A systematic review published in 2023 included 84 studies with retrospective/observational data and found the incidence of serotonin toxicity with linezolid monotherapy at 0.0050% and linezolid combination therapy at 0.0134%. All cases which discontinued linezolid and serotonergic agent/s at signs and symptoms of toxicity found symptom resolution; 75% of cases reported serotonin toxicity resolution within 24-48 h after discontinuation. The authors concluded that linezolid should not always be deferred due to the risk of serotonin syndrome and found a low prevalence of serotonin toxicity in both linezolid monotherapy and linezolid concurrent with other serotonergic agents. 2️⃣ A retrospective cohort study also published in 2023 evaluated the incidence of serotonin syndrome in 1743 patients that were exposed to at least one dose of linezolid, with or without serotonergic drugs. Roughly half of these patients received moderate and/or high dose serotonergic drugs during their linezolid exposure. Only two patients were identified as possible serotonin toxicity, leading the authors to conclude that even with multiple and high-dose serotonergic drugs, concomitant use of linezolid is likely safe…. 👀 Read the article for full context…. #Linezolid #Zyvox #Pharmacist #Pharmacy

👩‍💼👨‍💼Infectious diseases (ID) pharmacists are experts in 🦠antimicrobial 💊pharmacotherapy. This includes antibacterial, antiviral, antifungal, and antiparasitic drugs. Many of these pharmacists have also obtained substantial 🧠knowledge related to the diagnosis and management of infectious processes as well as 🧫clinical microbiology. ID pharmacists are also spearheading many antimicrobial stewardship programs… There are essentially four areas for ID pharmacists to practice. These may 🔀overlap for an individual ID pharmacist. 1️⃣🏥Inpatient clinical infectious diseases pharmacists 2️⃣ 🏘️Outpatient clinical infectious diseases pharmacists 3️⃣🖥️Antimicrobial stewardship pharmacists 4️⃣👨‍🏫👩‍🏫Academic infectious diseases pharmacists… more at IDstewardship.com under the main menu pick ID PharmD Q&A. #Pharmacist #Pharmacy #medicine #IDstewardship #Antibiotics #PharmacySchool

🫣Ever worked on a research project that went exactly as expected? 🫠Ya, me neither! 😂😂😂 …The older I get, the more I learn, and the more I realize how much I don’t know… if your research project 🔀 doesn’t go exactly as expected, don’t stress it too much. A big part of these projects is to 🤓learn how to do better research, which includes interpreting your current results to form rational conclusions - even when they aren’t exactly what you thought they’d be when you started the project 👌 ….. #pharmacy #pharmacist #IDstewardship #ClinicalResearch #QualityAssurance #PharmacySchool #pharmacyresearch #pharmacyresidency #pharmacypractice #bugsanddrugs #torturethedatauntilitconfesses
